column2: Loud 3D Movie That'll Jostles You Around
column3: If you've ridden the Ratatouille ride at Disneyland Paris, you'll know what to expect with the Universal Studios Hollywood Transformers 3D ride. It works the same way (you're in a ride vehicle that moves while wearing 3D glasses and moving around in front of giant video screens) except that instead of a nice little race through the streets of Paris with a mouse chef, you're thrust into some sort of battle with giant transforming robots.I don't really know what the heck was going on as far as the storyline of the ride goes, it was super loud and just a huge commotion with no real rhyme nor reason. It was sort of fun I guess, mostly because it's one of the longer rides in the park. But I don't really know what was happening except that there were big, giant robots screaming and jumping all over the place.There's a totally cool heat seeking missile effect that was pretty rad. Definitely worth waiting to ride this one, but I'd use caution if you're prone to motion sickness!
Great ride that is very well thought of. You need 4D glasses which are provided so that you can travel on the purpose built car through the simulator
A must do ride lots going on from every direction it takes you up down and around looking for the all spark

This ride jolts you around a lot in the simulated ride for the 3D thrills. There are a lot of Transformers fighting and changing shape, killing each other with gleaming eyes. There are a few 3D simulated rides at Universal and this one was one of the best. Buckle up because its a rough ride!

Another excellent ride at Universal. This is mainly a motion simulated ride but it does move quite a bit to really add to the experience. Interestingly the queue is nicely quieter than the one in Orlando which was good for our group (the loud queue caused some folks to backout). Good fun!
We went on many of the rides at Universal and our favorite was Transformers. Fun for the little kids and the teenagers. Highly recommend!

Very good ride, to me the best after the Harry Potter one. After paying 129 bucks to enter the park per person, it better be. Still, the lines, the lines...
